Class LongOption

  • java.lang.Object
    • monq.clifj.Option
      • monq.clifj.LongOption

  • public class LongOption
extends Option
    is a command line option with long valued arguments.
    Author:
    © 2005-2007 Harald Kirsch

      creates a command line option with default.

          java.lang.Object[] defalt)
           throws CommandlineException

        creates a command line option with default.

        Throws:
        CommandlineException - if the number of defaults is wrong or they are not of type Long or String or they fall outside the given ranges.

    • Method Detail

      • getTypeName

        public java.lang.String getTypeName()

      • check

        public java.lang.Object check(java.lang.Object v)
                       throws CommandlineException
        Description copied from class: Option

        checks if the given Object is a valid value for this option or can be converted to one. This method converts the value, if possible and necessary and returns the resulting Object.

        Hint: Subclasses must override this method to make sure the right objects are stored.

        Throws:
        CommandlineException - if the value does not meet the requirements for this option (e.g. wrong type, value too large) and cannot be (easily) converted.

      • addRestrictions

        public java.lang.String addRestrictions(java.lang.String s)
        Description copied from class: Option

        override in subclass to describe restrictions applied to values, like numerical range. The restrictions should describe what check() checks.
